projectPurpose: To provide a sophisticated and accurate open-source backtesting framework and trading bot for high-frequency trading and market-making strategies, focusing on granular tick data simulation, order book dynamics, queue position, and latency modeling.
mainFeatures: High-frequency trading and market making backtesting
Accounts for limit orders, queue positions, and latencies
Utilizes full tick data for trades and order books
Full order book reconstruction based on L2 and L3 feeds
Order fill simulation considering order queue position
Backtesting of multi-asset and multi-exchange models
Deployment of a live trading bot using the same algorithm code (Rust-only)
Real-world crypto market-making examples (e.g., Binance Futures)

marketPositioning: Hftbacktest is positioned as a specialized, open-source tool for high-frequency trading and market-making strategy development. Unlike many general-purpose backtesting frameworks, it places a strong emphasis on simulating market microstructure at the tick level, accurately accounting for factors like order book depth, queue position, and latency. This detailed approach, coupled with its support for both Python (with Numba acceleration) and Rust for performance, and the inclusion of live trading bot capabilities, makes it particularly suitable for quantitative traders and developers requiring high-fidelity simulations for HFT and market-making strategies, especially within the cryptocurrency domain as demonstrated by its examples. Its open-source nature provides transparency and flexibility compared to proprietary institutional solutions.
